thread.title: U.S. Defense Firms Want to Keep Tax Windfall

author: Doug Cameron
title: U.S. Defense Firms Want to Keep Tax Windfall
text:
U.S. defense executives urged lawmakers and federal officials to let them invest the windfall from new tax rules in weapons research rather than on lower prices for the Pentagon.
Lockheed Martin Corp. on Monday said it expects its tax rate to fall more than a third, to below 18%, and pledged to boost investment in new weapons and training. The worldâ€™s largest defense company by revenue also said it would make a $5 billion payment to its pension fund.
